樖字的基本解释

樖
kē
竹枝因风摇曳而相摩擦。
方言，量词，株；棵：门口有樖大榕树。

樖字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kē］
竹枝互相磨戛。一说树枝交连。

樖字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　樖； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页550第07
【字彙】見【揚雄·蜀都賦】。音義未詳。【正字通】本賦洪溶蔥葦，紛揚搔樖。言竹枝相磨戛也。讀若柯。○按《賦杪》本賦：洪溶忿葦，紛揚搔合。柯與風披，夾江緣山，尋卒而起。合字屬上句，柯字屬下句，樖字似誤。

樖字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
樖字的起名意思

暂无。

Ye
Basic explanation of words
Ye
kē
The bamboo branches rub against each other because of the wind swaying.
Dialect, quantifier, plant; Ke: There is a big banyan tree at the door.
Ye
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［kē］
The bamboo branches grind each other. One said that the branches are interconnected.
Ye
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　樖; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 550 No. 07
[Vocabulary] See [Yang Xiong·Shu Du Fu]. The sound and meaning are unclear. [Zhengzitong] This Fu Hongrong green onion reed, full of sorrows. It is said that the bamboo branches are mutually grinded. Read Ruoke. ○According to the "Fu Ye" Fu: Hong Rong Anxious Wei, diversified. Ke and the wind cloak, sandwiching the river and mountains, looking for pawns. The ligature belongs to the upper sentence, the Ke character belongs to the lower sentence, and the word "Yu" seems to be wrong.
